intro: Cicerbita rapunculoides, commonly known as the common cicerbit, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are usually alternate and pinnately lobed. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows. The plant has a short life cycle and is typically annual or biennial in nature.
